sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均有"大约，差不多"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: almost, nearly, about, approximately, around, roughly
means: almost ：指在程度上相差很小，差不多。
nearly与almost含义基本相同，侧重指数量、时间或空间上的接近。
about ：常可分almost和nearly换用，但about用于表示时间、数量的"大约"时，实际数量可能多也可能少。
approximately ：多用于书面语，指精确度接近某个标准以致误差可忽略不计。
around ：多用于非正式场合，常见于美国英语。

stems_affixes.word_buile: near近的+by旁边→adj.附近的 adv.附近

stems_affixes.value_cn: 亲近的[地], 亲密的[地]
stems_affixes.word_buile: near连接,邻近→adj.&adv.亲近的[地], 亲密的[地]
near近的+by旁边→adj.附近的 adv.附近
near近的+ly表副词→adv.几乎, 密切地

sentences.en: He can nearly swim.
sentences.cn: 他差不多会游泳了。

sentences.en: I was nearly killed in the accident.
sentences.cn: 我在这场事故中险些丧命。

sentences.en: The wind was so strong that people were nearly blown away as they waited for bus.
sentences.cn: 风刮得很厉害, 等候公共汽车的人们几乎要被风吹走。

sentences.en: Joe had a close call when his motorbike nearly collided with a lorry.
sentences.cn: 乔的摩托车差点同卡车相撞, 他侥幸地躲过了。

sentences.en: I was nearly drowned last night, but was fortunate enough to be saved.
sentences.cn: 我昨天夜里差一点淹死, 真走运, 有人把我救了。

sentences.en: He was nearly driven mad by his troubles.
sentences.cn: 他差一点被烦恼事逼疯了。

sentences.en: Suddenly the car in front of us drew out and nearly caused an accident.
sentences.cn: 我们前面的小汽车突然横穿了出来, 险些造成车祸。

sentences.en: The car is pretty nearly new.
sentences.cn: 这部汽车几乎是全新的。

sentences.en: Strange thoughts float through my mind when I am nearly asleep.
sentences.cn: 我快睡着时产生一种奇怪的念头。

sentences.en: Cars, trucks and buses produce exhaust nearly as harmful as the factories.
sentences.cn: 汽车、卡车和公共汽车排出的废气和工厂的废气差不多同样有害。

sentences.en: The patient, who had been asleep for nearly three hours, began to move his body.
sentences.cn: 病人睡了将近3小时, 才开始动一动身体。

sentences.en: Now that they've decided to build a shopping centre, nearly a hundred local people are going to be booked out of their homes.
sentences.cn: 既然他们现在已经决定要建立一个购物中心, 那么将近100名当地的居民就要被赶出自己的家园。

sentences.en: After nearly one year, the bike he lost was returned to him.
sentences.cn: 差不多过了一年, 他丢失的那辆自行车又回到他手里了。

sentences.en: You're nearly twenty, yet you keep saying silly things like that.
sentences.cn: 你已经快20岁了, 还老是说出那样傻乎乎的话来。

sentences.en: She was quite surprised when she was told that she owed them nearly twenty pounds.
sentences.cn: 当通知她欠了他们近20英镑时, 她感到十分诧异。

sentences.en: Time is nearly up.
sentences.cn: 时间差不多到了。

sentences.en: She stood nearly outside the door.
sentences.cn: 她几乎站在了门外。

sentences.en: We'd better stop at the garage to fill up, we're nearly out of petrol.
sentences.cn: 汽油快用光了, 我们最好在汽车修理厂停车加油。

sentences.en: Nearly all of the people believed him because he was a very good man.
sentences.cn: 因为他是个很好的人, 几乎所有的人都相信他。

sentences.en: Nearly every building was damaged in the earthquake.
sentences.cn: 在那次地震中几乎每座建筑物都遭到了破坏。

sentences.en: I used to go out nearly every night but I decided to cut it out because I couldn't really afford it.
sentences.cn: 我以前几乎每晚外出, 但现在已不是这样, 因为我实在抽不出时间。</seg>

sentence.cn: 在过去的25年中，玉米产量增长了近125％，而大米仅增长了7％。
sentence.en: Corn production has jumped nearly 125 percent over the past 25 years,  while rice has increased only 7 percent.
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

expand_knowledge_list.cn:
almost可与never,no,none,nothing,nobody,more than等连用
nearly可与not连用

lj.lj_ly: you're not nearly as clever as you think you are.
lj.lj_ls: 你远没有自认为的那样聪明。

entry.def: Nearly is used to indicate that something is not quite the case, or not completely the case.

example.ex: Goldsworth stared at me in silence for nearly twenty seconds...
example.tran: 将近20秒的时间，戈兹沃思就那么一声不响地盯着我看。

example.ex: Hunter knew nearly all of this already...
example.tran: 这事亨特几乎已全知道了。

entry.def: Nearly is used to indicate that something will soon be the case.

example.ex: It was already nearly eight o'clock...

entry.def: You use not nearly to emphasize that something is not the case.

example.ex: Father's flat in Paris wasn't nearly as grand as this...
example.tran: 爸爸在法国的公寓远不如这处宽敞。

example.ex: Minerals in general are not nearly so well absorbed as other nutrients...
example.tran: 总体来说，矿物质远远不如其他营养成分好吸收。

means.word_mean: 1. (of actions or states) slightly short of or not quite accomplished; `near' is sometimes used informally for `nearly' and `most' is sometimes used informally for `almost';

sentences.sentence: "the baby was almost asleep when the alarm sounded"
"the car all but ran her down"
"virtually all the parties signed the contract"
"I was near exhausted by the run"

sentences.cn: 这瓶子差不多空了。
sentences.en: The bottle's nearly empty.
